info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 3:44PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Washington, northeastern Rensselaer, southwestern Bennington and west central Windham Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 344 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Arlington to near Hoosick Falls. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Bennington, Hoosick Falls, Arlington, Stratton, Shaftsbury, West Wardsboro, Hoosick, White Creek, North Bennington, Sunderland, Wardsboro, Woodford, Old Bennington, Glastenbury, Somerset, Wardsboro Center, Center White Creek, Hoosick Junction, Paper Mill Village and Sodom. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for east central New York...and southern Vermont.
